resources.string: You need to give this app permission to change the settings before it will work, the only setting it will touch is the screen time-out.
Adding the widget to the home screen

1. Press the home button to get to the home screen.
2. Hold finger down on an area that is not occupied by an icon.
3. Select \"widgets\".
4. Scroll to \"ScreenWidget\" widget.
5. Drag and drop it into the home screen to where you want it.
6. Click on widget to change screen timeout mode.\n

1. Open the notification drawer.
2. Swipe down from the top to open the Quick Settings drawer.
3. Tap EDIT button.
4. Drag the tile named \"Screen Timeout\" into the Quick Settings drawer.
5. Tap back and you are ready to use tile.\n
When enabled, notification and statusbar icon will be shown in notification area when \"Always on\" mode activated
Restore last active state on boot. Useful, if you want timings to be restored to the state it was before device reboot.
Show Toast message once settings restored
Enable or disable multi-tap support for widget. Multi-tap feature allows increasing and decreasing widget timeout setting by using double and triple taps on widget.
Multi-tap smart multi stage delay: single click will pass much faster, then double and triple clicks reducing wait time.
Switch between always on and default timeout
Switch between last used timeout and default timeout
Select font size being used in widget. Useful to get best visual results with different launchers.
Widget icon size selection. Useful to get best visual results with different launchers.
%s minutes. Enter desired timeout value. Enter 0 to ignore this slot.
%s minutes. Enter desired timeout value. Enter 0 to ignore this slot.

%s minutes. Enter desired timeout value. Enter 0 to ignore this slot.
Automatically disable always on mode on low battery level.
